title: Age Tier Schema
description: Defines the structure for age-tier classification in curriculum governance

id.description: Unique identifier for the age tier (e.g., 'tier_1', 'tier_primary')

label.description: Human-readable name for the age tier

min_age.description: Minimum age in years for this tier

max_age.description: Maximum age in years for this tier

cognitive_profile.description: Description of cognitive capabilities, emotional maturity, and developmental characteristics for this tier
examples: Developing concrete reasoning; limited abstract thinking; high curiosity; emotionally vulnerable.
Emerging abstract reasoning; increased emotional resilience; developing critical thinking skills.
Fully developed abstract reasoning; high emotional resilience; capable of complex analysis.

permitted_content_categories.description: Categories of content that are permitted for this age tier

restricted_content_categories.description: Categories of content that are restricted for this age tier

parental_consent_required.description: Whether parental or guardian consent is mandatory for learners in this tier

notes.description: Additional context, guidance, or special considerations for this tier
examples: Content must be concrete, emotionally safe, and scaffolded for early learners.
Learners at this tier can engage with nuanced topics but require contextual framing.
